snippet: A Manhattan center run by the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals treats animals with histories of severe abuse and prepares them for adoption.
abstract: Newly opened American Society for Prevention of Cruelty to Animals center on Upper East Side of Manhattan was established to treat worst cases of animal abuse and to rehabilitate horrifically injured animals; center is part of partnership with New York Police Dept that began after society disbanded its small enforcement unit in 2014.

keywords.value: American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A Manhattan center run by the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals treats animals with histories of severe abuse and prepares them for adoption.

headline.print_headline: Dogs That Hurt the Most Now Have a Special Place to Heal
headline.main: Dogs Hurting the Most Have a Special Place to Heal
